rComments: I've taken two classes with Jeff - Charter Remedies in Criminal law and Extradition and he is one of the best professor's I've had! Engaging and easy to follow lectures as he explains complex legal issues clearly. Expectations for assignments and exams are very clear and he has a good sense of humour.

Jeff is an amazing prof this is my second class with him and I could not recommend him more. He lays out everything you need to know with so much detail and gives so many examples. Hes always available to answer your questions  

Bonus extradition  is so interesting and Jeff is truly an expert in the area. you wont regret taking this class

Professor Johnston did an excellent job of clearly explaining complex legal concepts and was very fair in his marking scheme of the factum and oral advocacy component of the class. I would highly suggest him as a professor.

I would 100% recommend taking this class, especially if you are hoping to a build a career in criminal law. This class was super helpful and taught me so much. Professor Johnston is a great professor, he explains things very clearly, is very kind, and is very straightforward about his expectations. One of the best professors I've had!

Jeff is a great professor. He explains complex issues in simple and easy to understand ways. He's always prepared and his classes are entertaining. I recommend taking a class with Jeff at least once in law school.
Amazing prof! Very laid back and approachable, very clear on his expectations, and bought us a round at the end of the year! What more can I say?

Jeff is a real gem. I had a blast in his class! He is very clear with giving information about cases and expectations for the moot/factum. The best experience in my first year was participating in the moot!! Jeff is down to earth and intelligent. Makes you feel very comfortable with asking questions. I would highly recommend taking his class!

You can always tell the professors that have a true passion for what they do - professor Johnston clearly loves teaching and it shows. He is incredibly knowledgeable about remedies and the content is highly relevant. The factum and moot activity were my favourite assignment for any of my first year classes and the most practical! Highly recommend!
One of the most talented professors at uOttawa Law. Will give you the absolute key building blocks for a criminal law practice and is pleasant to deal with.
Jeffrey Johnston is the best law school prof I had. I recommend taking his classes. He is an excellent lectuerer, fair graider, and is accessible to meet out of class.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Clear grading criteria', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: Best Prof ever.

If you have the chance to take a class with Jeff, don't hesitate to do it! Jeff is a seasoned professional & his teaching style reflects that. He is very clear, tells you what you need to know (& why) both for the exam and in practice. He provides useful feedback on assignments but takes a long time to mark. I wish he would teach advanced crim!

Perfect prof for 1L sm group! Jeff is a seasoned public lawyer & draws on his experience to share relevant stories. He's down to earth, approachable, & clear with expectations. Many felt comfortable speaking up in his class & asking questions. The rapport he helped build amongst classmates was helpful; we all still turn to each other for support.

Great lecturer! He's always very organized and concise. As he says all the time in class, you will walk out with a B. My only complaint is that he didn't make it clear how to get better than the B. He took forever to mark assignments so I didn't have much feedback to work off of.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Tough grader', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Take Jeffrey's class! He imparts material very well so it's not necessary to do the readings if you're caught up on other work. He is very fair and reasonable. Since he practices, he teaches you relevant information and doesn't get hung up on theory. Exams are long but you can expect a B.
Without hesitation the best first year law professor I had. Very practical and extremely knowledgable. Pay attention in class--he is very straightforward about what you need to know.

Professor Johnston is easily regarded as the best first year criminal law professor at uOttawa. He has a wealth of practical experience and teaches in a manner that is very practical. If you want substantial criminal law education, taught by the best, this should be an easy choice. Scratch the readings and pay attn in class. This guy is top notch.

I selected my small group to be lectured by a practitioner. I was pleased the uni snagged one of Johnston's  caliber. He's good at disseminating the law to novices too, spoon feeds legal tests and won't stray into tangents. He is very hard working, and I am grateful he dedicates his time to lecturing at uOttawa. Only complaint: night classes. Oye

The best prof you could possibly wish for, if you want to practice criminal law!! Definitely recommend taking this class. Jeff is so helpful and tells you everything you need to know. The exam is fair. All other criminal law related classes were so easy after taking crim law with Jeff.

IF YOU WANT TO PRACTISE CRIMINAL LAW. THIS IS THE PROFESSOR.  I have spoken to many law students about their crim proffesors and professor J has outdone all of them all.  You become a criminal law expert and are well prepared for 2nd year and even other classes.  MAKE SURE YOU GET IN THIS CLASS. A lot of readings- but you LEARN!!
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Tough grader', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Prof. Johnston is the best professor I have had in law school thus far. His teaching style is clear and he makes sure that each student understands the content. He gives you a thorough and practical understanding of criminal law, and ensures that you are well prepared for upper year courses. He also goes out of his way for his students.

Jeff is the BEST 1st year crim prof you could ever hope for. He's very clear and gets straight to the point - you'll be told exactly what you need to know to do well on the exams. He does assign a lot of reading but it's completely worth it when you're learning from a practitioner with his background and experience. I wish he were teaching more!!

Jeff is the most straight forward professor I had in my first year.  There are a lot of assigned readings but if you show up in class, he makes it obvious what you need to do to succeed in exams and assignments.

Jeff was one of my best professors during first year. He was a very clear and helpful lecturer. While he gave a fair bit of reading, he ensured that you knew what was important to take from each case. He was willing to talk after class and go over anything that wasn't making sense. I would recommend his class to anyone!

An amazing prof! Had him last year and learned so much about crim and Charter that Evidence and Con Law in second year were a breeze. Great lectures, very practical, tells you how it is in the real world, always down to answer extra questions. Haven't heard a single negative thing about him from any colleagues. We all loved him! Take his class!

Hands down one of the best profs I have ever had! His teaching method is that of a practitioner and I found that to be extremely helpful in a class such as criminal law. He is very clear about his expectations and is always available to give feedback. Very charismatic, funny and shares extremely interesting and relevant stories from his practice.

A very accessible professor who will take the time to make sure you understand the concepts.  He doesn't embellish the material with distracting tangents; everything is straight what you need to know to do well on the exams/assignments/future classes. He's a fair grader with a laid back style of teaching. :)

I highly recommend Prof. Johnston. I have taken both his crim pro and extradition classes, and if you are interested in criminal law his courses are a must. I use my notes from crim pro almost daily. He is very clear and his assignments/exams are very fair. His thoroughness put me at a huge advantage going in to my upper year crim courses.

Jeff was an awesome professor!  I had him as my small group criminal law professor for first year.  Yes, there are a lot of readings, but if you come to class, he is VERY good at summarizing cases.  His anecdotes were also great.  The assignments were all more or less worth 10% and the exams were each 25%. Easy to get a B or up.  Plus, he's cute!
Really nice prof, answers any question you have and clarifies it for you. Fun class to be in.
Smart prof. Doesnt waste your time blabbing about social justice issues like all the other profs in the school.
Great prof and class! I also had Jeff for first year crim. He is fair, helpful, and very knowledgeable in extradition law. The class was great! I highly recommend taking this class!

Prof. Johnston is the best you could ask for in getting a foundational understanding of crim law. He is clear and precise and though his expectations are high, they are fair. If you're interested in criminal law, you will have the best notes from this class that you can rely on in future years/interviews/placements.

This professor is excellent. He has been the clearest professor I have met at law school thus far. He is very open and approachable and is easily accessible to answer questions or address concerns. His experience in Criminal Law also adds a lot of unique insight to the course material.   His humerous anecdotes also keep things nice and light!

Jeff is a Crown attorney who focuses on the practical side of law. He made the course extremely interesting with stories from actual cases he worked on. He assigns a many readings but you only need to skim them before class to become familiar with the facts - he will tell you what the case stands for. Take his course If interested in crim.

Ignore the sour grapes, this guy is very good and earns his living in this field. You have to put the work into the course, but when you are finished you will be more familiar with the topic than most defence counsel.

Avoid this course at all costs! You will not be able to finish his exam, it is slated for three hours but you would need 4 to do it justice. There will be no quarter given in his marking either, if you are an A, or B student welcome to your first C or worse. Oh he'll be friendly and chatty but once you open up his exam good night nurse!

A warning if you want to take this guys Extradition Course. On this one he is out of the realm of his small group crim. grading requirements so his marking is absolutely brutal! You may get a fair bit of knowledge here but your transcript will take a serious hit and may well affect your future ability to land a summer job or articling position.

Really nice guy and extremely helpful.  Practicies in the criminal law area and knows his stuff.  Can be very funny.  Assigns a lot of caselaw but you learn a tonne and he reviews cases in detail in class and tells you what to take away.
Highly recommended professor if you have an interest in criminal law. Teaches the class in a very practical way and his exams are extremely fair.
A lot of readings but a very friendly and down to earth guy. Also very knowledgeable and appears before the SCC.
